sen.j: 打製石器（だせいせっき）とは、石を打ち砕いてつくられた石器で磨きをともなわないもの。
sen.e: Chipped stone tool is a stone tool made with smashed stone without giving a polish.
Chipped stone tool is a stone tool made with smashed stone without giving a polish.
Chipped stone tool is a stone tool made with smashed stone without giving a polish.

sen.j: 主に旧石器時代から縄文時代にかけて使われており、弥生時代に入って金属器が使われるようになると次第に減少した。
sen.e: It was mainly used in from the Paleolithic era to the Jomon period, but as metal tools came into use in the Yayoi period, the number of the stone tools decreased.
It was mainly used from the Paleolithic era to the Jomon period, but as metal tools came into use in the Yayoi period, the number of the stone tools decreased.
sen.cmt: ・訂正used in from the Paleolithic era→used from the Paleolithic era
sen.e: It was mainly used from the Paleolithic era to the Jomon period, but as metal tools came into use in the Yayoi period, the number of the stone tools decreased.

sen.j: 磨製石器に対する語。
sen.e: It is used in contrast with ground stone tools.
It is used in contrast with ground stone tools.
It is used in contrast with ground stone tools.

sen.j: 打製石器の材料としては、黒曜石、サヌカイト、頁岩などがある。
sen.e: Materials for chipped stone tools include obsidian, sanukite, and shale.
Materials for chipped stone tools include obsidian, sanukite, and shale.
Materials for chipped stone tools include obsidian, sanukite, and shale.

tit.e: The art of producing chipped stone tools
The art of producing chipped stone tools
The art of producing chipped stone tools

sen.j: 直接打法･･･石のハンマー（打撃具）を石材の一端に直接打ちつけて不要な部分を剥離する。
sen.e: Direct striking: striking a stone at an end with a stone hammer (a striking tool) and flaking unnecessary parts.
Direct striking: striking a stone at an end with a stone hammer (a striking tool) and flaking unnecessary parts.
Direct striking: striking a stone at an end with a stone hammer (a striking tool) and flaking unnecessary parts.

sen.j: 原石の形状を整えたり、おおまかに刃をつけたりする場合にも、この技術が用いられる。
sen.e: This technique is used to make the stone in a shape or to make a rough blade,
This technique is used to make the stone in a shape or to make a rough blade,
This technique is used to make the stone in a shape or to make a rough blade,

sen.j: 間接打法･･･打撃具を直接打ちつけるのではなく、石材の一端にシカの角（つの）や獣骨のタガネを当て、槌で間接的に打撃を加えて石片をはぎ取り、その石片（剥片とよぶ）から石刃技法をつくる。
sen.e: Indirect striking: Not by directly striking stones with hammers but by indirectly striking stones covered with deer's horns and bones or chisel made of animal bones to peel off a piece of stone (called a flake) and making a stone blade from it.

Indirect striking: Not by directly striking stones with hammers but by indirectly striking stones covered with deer's horns or chisel made of animal bones to peel off a piece of stone (called a flake) and making a stone blade from it.

Indirect striking: Not by directly striking stones with hammers but by indirectly striking stones covered with deer's horns or chisel made of animal bones to peel off a piece of stone (called a flake) and making a stone blade from it.

sen.j: 押圧剥離･･･石材の縁に尖ったシカの角や骨、あるいは木などの柔らかい打撃具を当て、力を加えて微細な石片を剥離する。
sen.e: Pressure-flaking: applying softer striking tools such as deer's horns and bones or wood to the edge of a stone and putting pressure on it to peel off a small piece of stone.
sen.cmt: 押圧剥離（加圧剥離ともいう）＝pressure-flaking 新和英大辞典
sen.e: Pressure-flaking: applying softer striking tools such as deer's horns and bones or wood to the edge of a stone and putting pressure on it to peel off a small piece of stone.
Pressure-flaking: applying softer striking tools such as deer's horns and bones or wood to the edge of a stone and putting pressure on it to peel off a small piece of stone.

sen.j: 尖頭器や細石刃などを作る細かい加工技法。
sen.e: This is a close processing technology for making points and microblades.
This is a close processing technique for making points and microblades.
This is a close processing technique for making points and microblades.

sen.j: 打製石器は時代に従って、石を砕いただけの礫器から、薄い剥片を用いた剥片石器・石の中央部を利用した石核石器へ移行し、最終的には細石器が用いられるようになった。
sen.e: Chipped stone tools changed from small stone tools made just by crushing stones to flake tools using thin flakes and core tools using the center part of a stone, and finally, microlithes came in use.
Chipped stone tools changed from small stone tools made just by crushing stones to flake tools using thin flakes and core tools using the center part of a stone, and finally, microlithes came in use.
Chipped stone tools changed from small stone tools made just by crushing stones to flake tools using thin flakes and core tools using the center part of a stone, and finally, microlithes came in use.

sen.j: 旧石器時代の打製石器には主に以下のようなものがある。
sen.e: Chipped stone tools in the Paleolithic era are as follows.
Chipped stone tools in the Paleolithic era are as follows.
Chipped stone tools in the Paleolithic era are as follows.

sen.j: ハンドアックス
sen.e: Hand ax
Hand ax
Hand ax

sen.j: 握斧、握槌ともよばれる。
sen.e: It is also called akufu and akutsui
It is also called akufu and nigiritsuchi.
sen.cmt: 調査の結果、握槌=nigiritsuchi との記述をいくつか発見しました。
sen.e: It is also called akufu and nigiritsuchi.

sen.j: 万能品として用いられた。
sen.e: It was used as an almighty tool.
It was used as an almighty tool.
It was used as an almighty tool.

sen.j: ブレイド
sen.e: Blade
Blade
Blade

sen.j: 石刃とも呼ばれる。
sen.e: It is also called as sekijin.
It is also called as sekijin.
It is also called as sekijin.

sen.j: 切る、削るなどの用途に用いられた鋭利な石器。
sen.e: It was a sharp stone tool used for such purposes as cutting and shaving.
It was a sharp stone tool used for such purposes as cutting and shaving.
It was a sharp stone tool used for such purposes as cutting and shaving.

sen.j: ポイント
sen.e: Point
Point
Point

sen.j: 尖頭器とも呼ばれる。
sen.e: It is also called sento-ki.
It is also called sento-ki.
It is also called sento-ki.

sen.j: 槍の先頭に付けられて、おもに狩猟のために用いられた。
sen.e: It was attached to the point of a pike and mainly used for hunting.
It was attached to the point of a pike and mainly used for hunting.
It was attached to the point of a pike and mainly used for hunting.

sen.j: 他にスクレイパーやナイフ形石器、彫器があった。
sen.e: Other types included a scraper, a stone tool resembling a knife, and a chiseling tool.
Other types included a scraper, a stone tool resembling a knife, and a chiseling tool.
Other types included a scraper, a stone tool resembling a knife, and a chiseling tool.

sen.j: 縄文時代になると石匙・石鏃・石錐・石斧・石槍など用途に応じた多様な打製石器がつくられるようになる。
sen.e: InJomon period, various kinds of chipped stone tools such as were made according to the use. Such tools included a stone spoon, a flint of arrowhead, a chipped-stone drill, a stone ax, and a stone pike.
In Jomon period, various kinds of chipped stone tools, including a stone spoon, a flint of arrowhead, a chipped-stone drill, a stone ax, and a stone pike, were made according to the use.
sen.cmt: ・修正trans1 が２文で構成されていたため、１文に修正しました。
sen.e: In Jomon period, various kinds of chipped stone tools, including a stone spoon, a flint of arrowhead, a chipped-stone drill, a stone ax, and a stone pike, were made according to the use.

sen.j: これらはいずれも剥片石器である。
sen.e: They are all flake tools
They are all flake tools
They are all flake tools

sen.j: これに対し、石核とは打製石器を制作した時に残った石材のことであり、原石の芯にあたる部分からつくり出された石器のことを石核石器という。
sen.e: In contrast with them, a core tool is a stone left when chipped stone tools are made, and stone tools made with the center part of a stone is called a core tool.
In contrast with them, a core tool is a stone left when chipped stone tools are made, and stone tools made with the center part of a stone is called a core tool.
In contrast with them, a core tool is a stone left when chipped stone tools are made, and stone tools made with the center part of a stone is called a core tool.
